repositories.brief_summary: Runtime improvements week with major GC optimizations and new free list representation for shared heap
repositories.overall_activity:
- Runtime **garbage collection optimizations** with [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) implementing mark-delay performance improvements ([#13580](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13580))
- **Shared heap memory management** enhancement by [Sadiq Jaffer](https://github.com/sadiqj) introducing run-length encoded free list representation ([#13616](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13616))
- **Domain error handling** improvements by [Guillaume Munch-Maccagnoni](https://github.com/gadmm) for correct exception handling during Domain.spawn ([#12410](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12410))
- **Platform support** expansion with x86_64 GNU/Hurd native backend enablement and ARM64 test fixes
- **Language features** progression including unboxed product arrays, modal modules, and uniqueness analysis improvements
repositories.ongoing_summary: Three core runtime PRs addressing garbage collection performance and memory management
repositories.ongoing_projects:
- **GC performance optimization** with mark-delay implementation providing up to 3.85x speedup for sparse heaps by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) ([#13580](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13580))
- **Shared heap efficiency** enhancement through run-length encoded free list representation by [Sadiq Jaffer](https://github.com/sadiqj) ([#13616](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13616))
- **Domain spawning reliability** fix for error handling during domain creation by [Guillaume Munch-Maccagnoni](https://github.com/gadmm) ([#12410](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12410))
repositories.priority_summary: Domain error handling PR needs review after recent rebasing and caml_result integration work
repositories.priority_items:
- **Domain spawn error handling** ([#12410](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12410)) by [Guillaume Munch-Maccagnoni](https://github.com/gadmm) requires review after rebasing and conversion to use caml_result instead of encoded exceptions
- **Mark-delay GC optimization** ([#13580](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13580)) needs final approval with multicoretests passing but showing one unrelated failure
- **Free list representation changes** ([#13616](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13616)) requires compactor updates to handle the new NOT_MARKABLE color scheme
repositories.trends_summary: Focus shifting toward runtime performance optimizations and memory management improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Runtime performance focus** with multiple PRs targeting garbage collection efficiency improvements and memory allocation optimizations
- **Platform compatibility expansion** with GNU/Hurd support additions and ARM64 test stabilization efforts
- **Code quality improvements** through better error handling patterns and debugging capabilities enhancement
repositories.contributors_summary: Runtime experts leading performance optimization efforts with extensive testing and benchmarking
repositories.contributors:
- [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) implemented mark-delay performance improvements for major GC ([#13580](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13580))
- [Sadiq Jaffer](https://github.com/sadiqj) developed run-length encoded free list representation for shared heap ([#13616](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13616))
- [Guillaume Munch-Maccagnoni](https://github.com/gadmm) worked on Domain.spawn error handling improvements ([#12410](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12410))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) provided review and guidance on multiple runtime PRs

repositories.brief_summary: Major release week: opam 2.3.0 officially launched with accompanying documentation and infrastructure updates
repositories.overall_activity:
- **Major release milestone** achieved with the official launch of [opam 2.3.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/releases/tag/2.3.0) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate)
- **Bug reports** surfaced regarding git-lfs compatibility issues ([#6298](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6298)) and Windows installation problems ([#6291](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6291))
- **Release infrastructure** improvements including install script updates and changelog finalization
- **Build system** enhancements with curl download command fixes by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou)
- **User experience** improvements including zsh detection fixes and linked switch removal handling
repositories.ongoing_summary: Two unresolved bugs affecting git-lfs integration and Windows package installation require investigation
repositories.ongoing_projects:
- **Git-lfs compatibility** investigation by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) to address pinning failures with repositories containing git-lfs files ([#6298](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6298))
- **Windows installation** debugging needed for ocaml-base-compiler download failures reported by [@GalihPRep](https://github.com/GalihPRep) ([#6291](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6291))
repositories.priority_summary: Git-lfs pinning bug marked for 2.3.1 milestone requires attention to prevent breaking changes
repositories.priority_items:
- **Git-lfs pinning failure** affecting repositories with shallow clones needs resolution as it represents an unknowing breaking change between opam versions ([#6298](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6298))
- **Windows download failures** for ocaml-base-compiler require investigation to determine if this is a temporary issue or broader problem ([#6291](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6291))
repositories.trends_summary: Post-release focus shifting toward platform-specific compatibility and edge case bug fixes
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Cross-platform compatibility** attention increasing with Windows-specific installation issues surfacing
- **Git workflow integration** becoming more complex as users adopt modern git features like git-lfs
- **Release cycle** showing rapid follow-up work with 2.3.1 milestone already being planned for critical fixes
repositories.contributors_summary: Release team actively maintaining opam 2.3.0 launch with multiple contributors handling different aspects
repositories.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) led the **opam 2.3.0 release** process, handling changelog updates, install script modifications, and addressing the git-lfs compatibility issue
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) contributed **build system improvements** with curl configuration fixes and CI infrastructure updates
- [@btjorge](https://github.com/btjorge) implemented **linked switch removal** functionality without failure conditions
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) improved **interactive user experience** by restoring uppercase characters in default prompts
- [@acasta-yhliu](https://github.com/acasta-yhliu) fixed **zsh shell detection** for ZDOTDIR environment handling

repositories.brief_summary: Type search feature merged and path shortening configuration issue raised
repositories.overall_activity:
- **Type search custom request** implementation by [PixieDust](https://github.com/PizieDust) merged into main branch ([#1369](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1369))
- **Path shortening configuration** issue reported by [Guillaume Bertholon](https://github.com/Sakarah) regarding inability to disable short-paths option ([#1395](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1395))
repositories.ongoing_summary: Type search client implementation planned for VSCode extension
repositories.ongoing_projects: - **VSCode client support** for type search functionality in development at [ocamllabs/vscode-ocaml-platform#1626](https://github.com/ocamllabs/vscode-ocaml-platform/issues/1626) following the merged server-side implementation ([#1369](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1369))
repositories.priority_summary: Path shortening configuration needs attention for project flexibility
repositories.priority_items: - **Path shortening configuration** requires investigation by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) to enable project-specific control over short-paths behavior ([#1395](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1395))
repositories.discussions_summary: Technical discussion on Dune flag workarounds for path shortening
repositories.notable_discussions: - **Dune build flags workaround** discussion between [Guillaume Bertholon](https://github.com/Sakarah) and [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) exploring `(:standard \ -short-paths)` configuration to disable path shortening in specific projects ([#1395](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1395))
repositories.contributors_summary: PixieDust completed type search feature, Sakarah reported configuration issue
repositories.contributors:
- [PixieDust](https://github.com/PizieDust) delivered comprehensive **type search custom request** implementation with server capability and documentation format support ([#1369](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1369))
- [Guillaume Bertholon](https://github.com/Sakarah) identified **path shortening limitation** affecting projects using type aliases and requiring configuration flexibility ([#1395](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1395))
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) provided **technical guidance** on potential Dune-based workarounds for path shortening configuration ([#1395](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1395))

repositories.brief_summary: Cache restoration bug reported and build system integration discussion with minor Wasm and Jsoo improvements
repositories.overall_activity:
- **Cache restoration bug** identified where empty directories are not properly restored from cache, causing downstream build invalidations ([#11117](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11117))
- **Build system integration** discussion around calling external make processes with proper job limits ([#11112](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/discussions/11112))
repositories.priority_summary: Cache bug affecting pkg feature and empty directory handling needs attention
repositories.priority_items: - **Dune cache restoration** bug causing rebuild cascades when empty directories aren't restored, particularly impacting OCaml 5.2.0 tarball processing with dune pkg feature ([#11117](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11117))
repositories.discussions_summary: Job limit coordination between dune and external make processes explored
repositories.notable_discussions: - **Build system integration** proposal by [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre) suggesting `(with-jobs N ...)` stanza for better job allocation when calling external build systems like make ([#11112](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/discussions/11112))
repositories.contributors_summary: mefyl reported critical cache issue, Lepigre proposed build system improvements
repositories.contributors:
- [@mefyl](https://github.com/mefyl) reported **cache restoration bug** affecting empty directories ([#11117](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11117))
- [Rodolphe Lepigre](https://github.com/rlepigre) initiated **build system integration** discussion on job management ([#11112](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/discussions/11112))
- [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) and [Emilio Jesús Gallego Arias](https://github.com/ejgallego) provided technical insight on related issues

repositories.brief_summary: Release preparation week with bug fixes for OCaml 5.2 compatibility and findlib 1.9.8 release
repositories.overall_activity:
- **Configure script fixes** addressing OCaml 5.2 compatibility issues with library detection, resolving `dynlink_subdir` parameter errors ([#88](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/88), [#90](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/90), [#92](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/pull/92))
- **Build system improvements** with missing `OCAMLOPT_SHARED` variable fix for bytes replacement compilation ([#89](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/89), [#93](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/pull/93))
- **Release 1.9.8** delivered by [@gerdstolpmann](https://github.com/gerdstolpmann) incorporating recent fixes and documentation updates ([#94](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/pull/94))
- **Opam configuration refinement** by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) removing experimental relative paths feature to reduce brittleness ([#91](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/pull/91))
repositories.discussions_summary: Community discussion on configure script improvements for OCaml 5.2
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Library detection strategy** discussion by [Adam Sampson](https://github.com/atsampson) providing patch for OCaml 5.2 compatibility where META files interfere with variable setting in configure script ([#88](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/88))
- **Opam integration concerns** addressed by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) regarding brittleness of `OPAM_SWITCH_PREFIX` dependency and its impact on package management ([#91](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/pull/91))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on OCaml 5.2 compatibility and build system stability
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **OCaml 5.2 compatibility** becoming priority with library detection fixes needed for bundled META files ([#88](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/88), [#92](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/pull/92))
- **Build reliability** improvements addressing missing variables and configure script robustness ([#89](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/89), [#93](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/pull/93))
- **Release cadence** with quick turnaround from bug reports to fixes and release deployment ([#94](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/pull/94))
repositories.contributors_summary: Active maintenance by gerdstolpmann with community contributions from dra27 and others
repositories.contributors:
- [@gerdstolpmann](https://github.com/gerdstolpmann) led **release activities** and applied multiple fixes including configure script and build system improvements ([#92](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/pull/92), [#93](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/pull/93), [#94](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/pull/94))
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) contributed **opam configuration improvements** removing experimental features that increased system brittleness ([#91](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/pull/91))
- [Daeho Ro](https://github.com/daeho-ro) and [Adam Sampson](https://github.com/atsampson) provided **issue reporting and patches** for OCaml 5.2 compatibility problems ([#88](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/88), [#90](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/90))

repositories.brief_summary: Documentation syntax improvements and infrastructure work with new markdown support and sidebar enhancements
repositories.overall_activity:
- **Documentation syntax improvements** with implicit tag ending implementation by [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd), resolving long-standing issue with tag behavior ([#1239](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1239), [#1138](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1138))
- **Markdown support introduction** by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) through new `odoc-md` package for processing standalone markdown files ([#1234](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1234))
- **Publishing infrastructure** enhancement with HTML remap mode by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) enabling package docs publishing on custom sites ([#1248](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1248))
- **Sidebar and indexing overhaul** with multiple related PRs from [Guillaume Petiot](https://github.com/gpetiot) and [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) improving navigation experience ([#1244](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1244), [#1246](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1246), [#1243](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1243))
- **Driver improvements** with better package/library argument handling by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) ([#1229](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1229)) and dependency fixes by [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) ([#1249](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1249))
repositories.ongoing_summary: Documentation system modernization with enhanced sidebar navigation and markdown processing capabilities
repositories.ongoing_projects:
- **Sidebar and navigation redesign** continuing with discussions about optimal hierarchy display and user experience improvements based on ongoing work in [#1244](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1244) and [#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220)
- **Documentation syntax evolution** with tag delimiter proposals under active discussion in [#1226](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1226), including various syntax options like `{@tag ...}` and `@begin-block/@end-block` delimiters
- **Publishing workflow enhancement** with HTML remap functionality now merged and voodoo integration improvements through [#1241](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1241) enabling better cross-package documentation linking
repositories.priority_summary: Unresolved alert handling bug and ongoing syntax delimiter discussions need attention
repositories.priority_items:
- **Type alias alert handling** bug reported by [favonia](https://github.com/favonia) where odoc cannot handle deprecation alerts on type aliases while OCaml compiler accepts them ([#1230](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1230))
- **Tag delimiter syntax decision** requiring community input on preferred approach from multiple proposals including `{@tag ...}`, `@begin-block/@end-block`, and `{| |}` delimiters ([#1226](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1226))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus shifting toward user experience improvements and documentation publishing workflows
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Enhanced publishing capabilities** with new HTML remap mode allowing packages to publish docs on their own sites while maintaining links to ocaml.org ([#1248](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1248))
- **Markdown ecosystem integration** through standalone markdown processing support, expanding beyond traditional OCaml documentation workflows ([#1234](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1234))
- **Driver architecture evolution** with improved package/library argument handling and split compile/link phases for more flexible documentation generation ([#1229](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1229), [#1241](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1241))
repositories.contributors_summary: Active collaboration between core team members on infrastructure improvements
repositories.contributors:
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) leading infrastructure work with HTML remap mode ([#1248](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1248)), markdown support ([#1234](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1234)), driver improvements ([#1229](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1229)), and voodoo integration ([#1241](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1241))
- [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) implementing documentation syntax improvements with implicit tag ending ([#1239](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1239)), short title support ([#1246](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1246)), children ordering ([#1243](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1243)), and core type identifier cleanup ([#1242](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1242))
- [Guillaume Petiot](https://github.com/gpetiot) contributing to sidebar overhaul ([#1244](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1244)) with focus on navigation hierarchy improvements
- [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto) maintaining CI infrastructure with setup-ocaml updates ([#1153](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1153))

repositories.brief_summary: Active week with new package releases and opam 2.3.0 ecosystem updates via direct repository commits
repositories.overall_activity:
- Multiple **new package releases** including coccinelle 1.3.0, ppx_deriving_yaml 2.4.0, and bitwuzla-cxx 0.6.1 by [Frédéric Recoules](https://github.com/recoules) and other contributors
- **opam 2.3.0 release** deployment by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) with 8 packages from [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) and pre-release warning system
- **Lwt 5.9.0** package submission by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) from [ocsigen/lwt](https://github.com/ocsigen/lwt)
- **cmdlang 0.0.8** release with 4 packages by [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin)
- **Development tool updates** including ocamlformat-mlx 0.26.2.0 by [Andrey Popp](https://github.com/andreypopp) and dream-encoding 0.3.0 by [Thibaut Mattio](https://github.com/tmattio)
- **Infrastructure improvements** including pkg-config to pkgconf migration for Homebrew compatibility and Cygwin package additions
- **Tezos ecosystem** updates with Octez 21.0 packages and **AWS SDK preview** packages from smaws 0.1-preview1
